questionText: What is the capital of France?
explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since 508 AD

questionText: Who wrote "Hamlet"?
options: [Charles Dickens, Jane Austen, William Shakespeare, Mark Twain]
explanation: Hamlet is one of Shakespeare's most famous plays

questionText: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
options: [Atlantic Ocean, Indian Ocean, Arctic Ocean, Pacific Ocean]
explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers more area than all the landmasses combined

questionText: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
options: [Vincent van Gogh, Pablo Picasso, Leonardo da Vinci, Claude Monet]
explanation: The Mona Lisa is a renowned work by the Italian Renaissance artist

questionText: What is the longest river in the world?
options: [Amazon River, Nile River, Yangtze River, Mississippi River]
explanation: The Nile River is traditionally considered the longest river

questionText: Which element has the chemical symbol "O"?
explanation: Oxygen is essential for respiration in most living organisms

questionText: In which year did the Titanic sink?
explanation: The Titanic sank on its maiden voyage in April 1912

questionText: What is the smallest planet in our solar system?
explanation: Mercury is the smallest planet and closest to the Sun

questionText: Who discovered penicillin?
options: [Marie Curie, Alexander Fleming, Louis Pasteur, Albert Einstein]
explanation: Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928, revolutionizing medicine

questionText: What is the main ingredient in guacamole?
explanation: Guacamole is primarily made from mashed avocados

questionText: Which country is known as the Land of the Rising Sun?
explanation: Japan is called this due to its position east of the Asian continent

questionText: What is the capital city of Australia?
explanation: Canberra was selected as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne

questionText: Which continent is the Sahara Desert located in?
explanation: The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world, located in North Africa

questionText: What river flows through Egypt?
explanation: The Nile is often regarded as the lifeblood of Egypt

questionText: Which mountain range separates Europe and Asia?
explanation: The Ural Mountains are traditionally considered the boundary between the two continents

questionText: What is the largest country in the world by area?
explanation: Russia spans over 17 million square kilometers

questionText: Which ocean is the largest?
explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers more than 63 million square miles

questionText: What is the capital of Canada?
explanation: Ottawa is the political and administrative center of Canada

questionText: In which country is the Great Barrier Reef located?
explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system

questionText: What is the smallest country in the world?
explanation: Vatican City is an independent city-state enclaved within Rome

questionText: Who was the first President of the United States?
options: [Thomas Jefferson, Abraham Lincoln, George Washington, John Adams]
explanation: Washington served as President from 1789 to 1797

questionText: What ancient civilization built the pyramids?
explanation: The ancient Egyptians constructed pyramids as tombs for their pharaohs

questionText: What year did World War II begin?
explanation: World War II began with the invasion of Poland in September 1939

questionText: Who was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean?
options: [Amelia Earhart, Bessie Coleman, Harriet Quimby, Jacqueline Cochran]
explanation: Earhart completed her historic flight in 1932

questionText: What was the name of the ship that sank after hitting an iceberg in 1912?
explanation: The Titanic sank on its maiden voyage on April 15, 1912

questionText: Who is known as the Father of Modern Physics?
options: [Isaac Newton, Albert Einstein, Galileo Galilei, Niels Bohr]
explanation: Einstein developed the theory of relativity, changing our understanding of physics

questionText: What was the main cause of the Cold War?
options: [Capitalism vs. Communism, World War I, The Great Depression, Imperialism]
explanation: The Cold War was characterized by ideological conflict between the U.S. and the Soviet Union

questionText: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?
explanation: The fall of the Berlin Wall symbolized the end of the Cold War

questionText: Who was the last Tsar of Russia?
options: [Nicholas II, Alexander III, Peter the Great, Catherine the Great]
explanation: Nicholas II was executed during the Russian Revolution in 1918

questionText: What year did the United States declare independence?
explanation: The Declaration of Independence was adopted on July 4, 1776

questionText: What is the chemical symbol for water?
explanation: Water is composed of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom

questionText: What planet is known as the Red Planet?
explanation: Mars appears red due to iron oxide, commonly known as rust

questionText: What gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere?
explanation: Plants use carbon dioxide during photosynthesis to produce oxygen

questionText: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
explanation: Mitochondria generate ATP, the energy currency of the cell

questionText: How many bones are in the adult human body?
explanation: Adults typically have 206 bones, while infants have more that fuse over time

questionText: What is the largest mammal in the world?
options: [Elephant, Blue Whale, Giraffe, Great White Shark]
explanation: Blue whales can reach lengths of up to 100 feet and weigh as much as 200 tons

questionText: What type of celestial body is the Sun?
explanation: The Sun is a star at the center of our solar system

questionText: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
explanation: Diamonds are formed under extreme pressure and are known for their hardness

questionText: What part of the plant conducts photosynthesis?
explanation: Leaves contain chlorophyll, which captures sunlight for photosynthesis

questionText: What is the process by which plants make their food?
explanation: Photosynthesis converts sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide into glucose and oxygen

questionText: Who directed "Titanic"?
options: [James Cameron, Steven Spielberg, George Lucas, Martin Scorsese]
explanation: James Cameron directed the blockbuster film released in 1997

questionText: What is the highest-grossing film of all time (as of 2023)?
options: [Avatar, Avengers: Endgame, Titanic, Star Wars: The Force Awakens]

questionText: Which character is known as the "Boy Who Lived"?
options: [Hermione Granger, Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Draco Malfoy]

questionText: What TV show features the character Sheldon Cooper?
options: [Friends, The Big Bang Theory, How I Met Your Mother, Brooklyn Nine-Nine]

questionText: Who played Jack Dawson in "Titanic"?

questionText: What is the name of the fictional African country in "Black Panther"?
explanation: Wakanda is known for its advanced technology and vibranium resources.

questionText: Who is the creator of the television series "The Simpsons"?
options: [Matt Groening, Seth MacFarlane, Trey Parker, Mike Judge]
explanation: Groening created The Simpsons," which first aired in 1989.

questionText: What animated film features a talking fish searching for his son?
options: [Finding Nemo, Toy Story, The Lion King, Zootopia]
explanation: The film follows Marlin's journey to find his son, Nemo.

questionText: What is the name of the main character in "The Matrix"?
explanation: Neo, played by Keanu Reeves, is the protagonist in the sci-fi film.

questionText: Who won the Academy Award for Best Actress in 2021?
options: [Frances McDormand, Viola Davis, Carey Mulligan, Andra Day]
explanation: McDormand won for her role in Nomadland.

questionText: Quel est le plus grand océan du monde?
explanation: L'océan Pacifique couvre plus de 63 millions de miles carrés.

questionText: Qui a écrit Les Misérables"?
options: [Victor Hugo, Émile Zola, Gustave Flaubert, Marcel Proust]
explanation: Les Misérables est un chef-d'œuvre de la littérature française.

questionText: Quel est le pays d'origine de la pizza?
explanation: La pizza est originaire de Naples, en Italie.

questionText: Qui a inventé le téléphone?
options: [Alexander Graham Bell, Thomas Edison, Nikola Tesla, Gustav Eiffel]
explanation: Bell a breveté le téléphone en 1876.

questionText: Quel est le symbole chimique du fer?
explanation: Le fer a pour symbole chimique Fe" provenant du latin "ferrum".

questionText: Quel est le plus haut sommet du monde?
explanation: Le Mont Everest culmine à 8 848 mètres d'altitude.

questionText: Qui a peint La Nuit étoilée"?
options: [Claude Monet, Vincent van Gogh, Pablo Picasso, Henri Matisse]
explanation: La Nuit étoilée est l'une des œuvres les plus célèbres de Van Gogh.

questionText: Quel est le principal ingrédient du pain?
explanation: La farine est l'ingrédient de base pour faire du pain.

questionText: Quelle est la capitale de l'Italie?
explanation: Rome est connue pour ses monuments historiques et son 672d0698004c7514fcd799b2 riche.

questionText: Quel est le film le plus primé aux Oscars?
options: [Titanic, Le Parrain, Autant en emporte le vent, Avengers: Endgame]
explanation: Titanic a remporté 11 Oscars en 1998.

questionText: Quelle est la plus grande île du monde?
explanation: La Groenland est la plus grande île, recouverte principalement de glace.

questionText: Quel est le pays le plus peuplé?
explanation: La Chine a une population de plus de 1,4 milliard d'habitants.

questionText: Quelle est la capitale du Japon?
explanation: Tokyo est la capitale du Japon et une métropole animée.

questionText: Quelle chaîne de montagnes traverse l'Amérique du Sud?
explanation: Les Andes sont la plus longue chaîne de montagnes du monde.

questionText: Quel est le fleuve le plus long d'Europe?
explanation: Le Danube mesure environ 2 860 kilomètres de long.

questionText: Quel pays est connu pour ses fjords?
explanation: La Norvège est célèbre pour ses magnifiques fjords.

questionText: Quelle est la capitale de l'Argentine?
explanation: Buenos Aires est connue pour sa culture et sa danse tango.

questionText: Quel est le désert le plus grand du monde?
explanation: Le désert de l'Antarctique est le plus vaste et le plus sec.

questionText: Quelle est la capitale de l'Australie?
explanation: Canberra a été choisie comme un compromis entre Sydney et Melbourne.

questionText: Quel est le point le plus bas de la Terre?
options: [Mer Morte, Caverne de Mammoth, Dépression de Mariana, Cratère de Chicxulub]
explanation: La Mer Morte est située à environ 430 mètres sous le niveau de la mer.

questionText: Qui a été le premier président de la France?
options: [Charles de Gaulle, Napoléon Bonaparte, Georges Pompidou, François Mitterrand]
explanation: Napoléon a été le premier président en 1804.

questionText: Quand a eu lieu la Révolution française?
explanation: La Révolution française a commencé en juillet 1789.

questionText: Qui a découvert l'Amérique?
options: [Christophe Colomb, Ferdinand Magellan, Vasco de Gama, Hernán Cortés]
explanation: Colomb a découvert l'Amérique en 1492.

questionText: Qui était le roi de France pendant la Révolution?
options: [Louis XIV, Louis XVI, Louis XV, Charles X]
explanation: Louis XVI a été exécuté en 1793.

questionText: Quelle guerre a opposé le Nord et le Sud des États-Unis?
options: [Guerre de Sécession, Première Guerre mondiale, Deuxième Guerre mondiale, Guerre froide]
explanation: La Guerre de Sécession a eu lieu de 1861 à 1865.

questionText: Quel mouvement a été fondé par Martin Luther King?
options: [Mouvement des droits civiques, Mouvement féministe, Mouvement abolitionniste, Mouvement écologiste]
explanation: King a lutté pour l'égalité raciale aux États-Unis.

questionText: Quel événement a déclenché la Première Guerre mondiale?
options: [L'assassinat de l'archiduc François-Ferdinand, La Révolution russe, L'invasion de la Pologne, Le traité de Versailles]
explanation: Cet événement a eu lieu en 1914.

questionText: Qui a écrit Le Contrat social"?
explanation: Rousseau a écrit sur la politique et la société au XVIIIe siècle.

questionText: Quand a été signé le traité de Versailles?
explanation: Le traité de Versailles a mis fin à la Première Guerre mondiale.

questionText: Qui était la première femme à obtenir le prix Nobel?
options: [Marie Curie, Rosalind Franklin, Ada Lovelace, Florence Nightingale]
explanation: Marie Curie a reçu le prix Nobel de physique en 1903.

questionText: Quel est l'organe responsable de la respiration?
explanation: Les poumons permettent l'échange de gaz dans le corps.

questionText: Quel est le symbole chimique du sodium?
explanation: Le sodium est représenté par le symbole Na", dérivé du latin.

questionText: Combien de planètes dans notre système solaire?
explanation: Il y a huit planètes dans notre système solaire.

questionText: Quelle est la plus grande espèce de requin?
options: [Requin blanc, Requin baleine, Requin tigre, Requin marteau]
explanation: Le requin baleine peut mesurer jusqu'à 12 mètres de long.

questionText: Quel est le principal gaz à effet de serre?
explanation: Le dioxyde de carbone est le principal responsable du réchauffement climatique.

questionText: Quel est le processus par lequel les plantes fabriquent leur nourriture?
explanation: Les plantes convertissent la lumière du soleil en énergie.

questionText: Quel animal est connu pour sa mémoire exceptionnelle?
explanation: Les éléphants sont connus pour leur mémoire remarquable.

questionText: Quel est l'organe qui pompe le sang dans le corps?
explanation: Le coeur est le moteur circulatoire du corps.

questionText: Quel est l'élément le plus léger?
explanation: L'hydrogène est l'élément le plus léger et le plus abondant dans l'univers.

questionText: Quelle est la fonction principale des racines des plantes?
explanation: Les racines absorbent l'eau et les nutriments du sol.

questionText: Qui a réalisé Titanic"?
options: [James Cameron, Steven Spielberg, Martin Scorsese, Christopher Nolan]
explanation: James Cameron a réalisé Titanic" en 1997.

questionText: Quel film a remporté l'Oscar du meilleur film en 2020?
options: [Parasite, 1917, Joker, Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]
explanation: Parasite a été le premier film non anglophone à remporter cet Oscar.

questionText: Qui joue le rôle principal dans Le Parrain"?
options: [Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Marlon Brando, Jack Nicholson]
explanation: Marlon Brando incarne Vito Corleone dans ce classique du cinéma.

questionText: Quel est le nom de la série mettant en scène un groupe de survivants sur une île déserte?
options: [Lost, Survivor, The Walking Dead, Stranger Things]

questionText: Quel acteur a joué le rôle de Jack Dawson dans Titanic"?
options: [Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Johnny Depp]

questionText: Quel film d'animation a été produit par Pixar et met en scène des jouets?
options: [Toy Story, Monstres et Cie, Finding Nemo, Cars]
explanation: Toy Story a été le premier film d'animation entièrement en 3D.

questionText: Quelle série suit les aventures d'un groupe d'amis à New York?
options: [Friends, How I Met Your Mother, The Office, Seinfeld]

questionText: Quel film raconte l'672d0698004c7514fcd799b2 de la vie d'un célèbre boxeur nommé Rocky?
explanation: Rocky est un film culte qui a remporté l'Oscar du meilleur film.

questionText: Qui interprète le personnage de Walter White dans Breaking Bad"?
options: [Bryan Cranston, Aaron Paul, Bob Odenkirk, Dean Norris]

questionText: Quel film de Tim Burton met en scène un personnage nommé Edward aux mains d'argent?
options: [Edward Scissorhands, Beetlejuice, The Nightmare Before Christmas, Sweeney Todd]
explanation: Edward aux mains d'argent est l'un des films emblématiques de Tim Burton.
